question: [File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Integration: keyless_validation.rs] [Cryptographic Weakness] Can training_wheels_pubkey deserialization in keyless_validation.rs line 228 fail silently returning None instead of error, disabling training wheels protection without notification? [File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Integration: circuit_constants.rs] [Constant Mismatch] Can circuit_constants::MAX_ISS_VAL_BYTES be modified in new circuit deployment while on-chain Configuration retains old value, causing proof verification failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Integration: circuit_constants.rs] [Constant Mismatch] Can circuit_constants::MAX_EXTRA_FIELD_BYTES diverge from Configuration.max_extra_field_bytes allowing proofs with extra fields that exceed circuit capacity? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Integration: circuit_constants.rs] [Constant Mismatch] Can circuit_constants::MAX_JWT_HEADER_B64_BYTES be reduced in new circuit while Configuration allows larger headers, causing all new proofs to fail validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [Epoch Boundary] Can Configuration changes at epoch boundary cause split-brain where some validators use old config and others use new config for same block? (Critical)
